alert.note: Alert for Blount; Etowah; Jefferson; Shelby; St. Clair; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 1:17AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Talladega, southeastern Blount, central Shelby, southwestern Etowah, east central Jefferson and St. Clair Counties through 200 AM CST... At 117 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Clay to near Greystone to near Calera. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Birmingham, Vestavia Hills, Pelham, Trussville, Pell City, Irondale, Leeds, Moody, Calera, Chelsea, Rainbow City, Springville, Odenville, Center Point, Clay, Pinson, Lincoln, Margaret, Argo and Ashville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for central, northeastern and east central Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Blount; Etowah; Jefferson; Shelby; St. Clair; Talladega
